subject: Re: [junit] Re: testing private methods in Struts Actions ?
msgSnippet: ... I would explore using StrutsTestCase. My next alternative would be to use plain JUnit. Most of the Action classes will be the same, anyway. ... May I
messageBody:
frank zou wrote:

> > I like this approach, although I must say that I never used
> StrutsTestCase.
> >
>
> If you will use Struts, what testing tool you may use to test Action
> related stuff ?

I would explore using StrutsTestCase. My next alternative would be to
use plain JUnit. Most of the Action classes will be the same, anyway.

> > > English is just my second language. I am not sure whether I express
> > > myself clear enough. :(
> >
> > Very clearly. Which is your first language?
>
> My native language is Chinese.
>
> By the way, the junit related books, like "Junit In Action" and
> "Pragmatic Unit Testing In Java With Junit", are already available in
> China market. Do you have plan to introduce your book to China ? I saw
> some messages on some BBS where Chinese java programmers gather,
> saying your book is "the most practical junit book ever seen". I guess
> translating your book into Chinese would benefit the whole java
> community in China. :)

May I forward this comment to my publisher?
